summary: An energetic, skillful and dedicated Administrative Assistant offering versatile office management, planning and detailed skills. Able to provide extensive experience of administrative support, organization, time management and confidentiality for executive-level staff of daily operations and functions. Ambitious and goal-oriented individual looking to obtain a position at a successful company which offers opportunities for professional growth.
skills: Manage work flow of an office
Edit and proofread department documents and marketing collateral

experience.title: Secretary - Finance Division
experience.description: Manage records retention for the department; professionally respond to daily phone calls; filing, organizing; edit and proofread documents and marketing collateral; create and manage committee meeting agendas (Finance and Investment Advisory Committees) using AgendaQuick; handle and manage all Massage Establishment permits in Brea; create Desk Diary and Influential Communicator's list; assist Finance Manager with Lease Revenue and Water Bonds, Recognized Obligation Payments Schedule (ROPS), and other deadline oriented projects; provide support to other divisions while maintaining privacy; supervise Volunteen annually.

experience.title: Secretary - Communications & Marketing Division
experience.description: Maintain same job duties as the beginning of my career with the Communications and Marketing division, but at half-time. Duties include tracking all jobs through department filing, organizing, editing and proofreading documents and marketing collateral; open, read, and write answers to routine letters; prepare and distribute payroll for staff; oversee inventory and office supply purchases; manage supervisor's calendar and coordinate team meetings; create and design PowerPoint presentations for special meetings with top-level executives; provide various reports on request; regularly correspond with clients as well as co-workers; community outreach; gather data on community needs and interests; coordinate employee luncheons, celebrations and annual events; maintain up-to-date program files; develop and send out Marketing Weekly via email; press releases; social media.

experience.title: Secretary - Communications & Marketing Division
experience.description: Manage workflow of office work with city council and executives on various events including city council meetings; professionally respond to multiple daily phone calls regarding a wide range of subjects; revise Desk Diary, press releases, flyers, etc.; social media; create presentations for meetings; City Plaque Inventory created; C&M Weekly concept for efficiency; maintain Influential Communicator's list; company credit cards; create Emergency go kits; community outreach; maintain equipment inventory; Department Coordinator, Weight Room Rehabilitation, Employee.

education.degree: Master of Science in Psychology, Mental Health and Well Being
Bachelor of Science in Education, Educational Studies
Associate of Science in General Education

certifications: EOC backup for public information office
